question: A series LCR circuit containing an AC source of 100V has an inductor and a capacitor of reactances <katex>$24\Omega$</katex> and <katex>$16\Omega$</katex> respectively. If a resistance of <katex>$6\Omega$</katex> is connected in series, then the potential difference across the series combination of inductor and capacitor only is
explanation: Net reactance of L and C: <katex>$X_{net} = X_L - X_C = 8 \Omega$</katex>.
Voltage across L-C combination <katex>$V_{LC} = I \times X_{net} = 10 \times 8 = 80$</katex> V.
